page.title: 13Junction House Farm
page.content: Junction House Farm is about 150 years old and covers 220 acres or 90 hectares. Mr & Mrs Hutchinson and his brother keep about 50 cattle to fatten and sell at Dartlington Mart. He has Fresian, Hereford, and Aberdeen Angus cattle which he buys from local farmers and friends. In summer the cattle feed on grass and the calves have powdered milk and calf-cutlets. In winter they are brought inside and eat silage, hay, sugar beet and nuts. A new barn is now being built for the cattle in winter. In his fields he grows wheat, barley, hay oil seed, rape, peas and potatoes. He sells most of this but keeps hay, straw, and some barley for animal feed. There are many machines which Mr Hutchinson uses. To prepare the land he uses a plough and a power harrow. To sow seeds he has a corn drill and potato planter.
